se.jguru.nazgul.core.osgi.launcher.api

Interface FrameworkLauncher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractFrameworkLauncher

    public interface FrameworkLauncher

    Specification for launching an OSGi Framework from within the currently running application. The lifecycle of a FrameworkLauncher is as follows:

    Startup sequence

          // Inject or acquire the FrameworkLauncher instance,
      // and any supplied configuration data.
      final FrameworkLauncher launcher = ....
      final Map<String, Object> configuration = ...

      // Initialize the FrameworkLauncher
      launcher.initialize(configuration);

      // Start the FrameworkLauncher; acquire the started Framework.
      launcher.start();
      final Framework framework = launcher.getFramework();

    Shutdown sequence

          // Acquire the FrameworkLauncher instance,
      final FrameworkLauncher launcher = ....

      // Stop the FrameworkLauncher; which will stop
      // the managed OSGi Framework.
      launcher.stop();
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String DEFAULT_JVM_BOOTDELEGATION_PACKAGES
      The standard boot delegation packages (i.e. packages intended to be loaded by the ClassLoader of the embedding container or runtime), originating from the Sun/Oracle JVM.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.osgi.framework.launch.Framework getFramework()
      Acquires the OSGi framework from the underlying container.
      void initialize(Map<String,String> configuration)
      Initializes this launcher using the provided configuration map.
      void start()
      Starts the embedded OSGi container.
      void stop()
      Stops the embedded OSGi container.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_JVM_BOOTDELEGATION_PACKAGES

        static final String DEFAULT_JVM_BOOTDELEGATION_PACKAGES
        The standard boot delegation packages (i.e. packages intended to be loaded by the ClassLoader of the embedding container or runtime), originating from the Sun/Oracle JVM.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(Map<String,String> configuration)
         throws IllegalStateException
        Initializes this launcher using the provided configuration map.
        Parameters:
        configuration - A Map holding configuration data for the underlying OSGi container.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the container was already started; initializing a running container yields undefined results.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the configuration was deemed inappropriate for initializing the underlying container.

      • start

        void start()
    throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException,
           IllegalStateException
        Starts the embedded OSGi container.
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the container could not be started.
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying OSGi framework was not created/initialized.

      • getFramework

        org.osgi.framework.launch.Framework getFramework()
        Acquires the OSGi framework from the underlying container.
        Returns:
        The Framework of the running Container, or null if the Framework was not created (i.e. the FrameworkFactory was not run yet).

      • stop

        void stop()
   throws org.osgi.framework.BundleException,
          IllegalStateException
        Stops the embedded OSGi container.
        Throws:
        org.osgi.framework.BundleException - if the container could not be stopped.
        IllegalStateException - if the underlying OSGi framework was not created/initialized.
